intro: Matelea congestiflora, commonly known as the clustered-flowered matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences of pink to reddish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually woody and branched. Matelea congestiflora is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
